title: Sharon Ikeazor on Twitter
body: Thanks to all our amazing youth who were part of the event and their awesome project presentations on plastic pollution-solutions. Speakers were great @RitaIdehai @BanjoOluyomi @Doyin_Ogunye @WBG_Nigeria @FMEnvng. @UNIDO_Nigeria #GenerationRestoration #EndPlasticPollution https: ...
readable_content:
Sharon Ikeazor (@sharon_ikeazor) (2021-06-05):
Thanks to all our amazing youth who were part of the event and their awesome project presentations on plastic pollution-solutions. Speakers were great @RitaIdehai @BanjoOluyomi @Doyin_Ogunye @WBG_Nigeria @FMEnvng. @UNIDO_Nigeria #GenerationRestoration #EndPlasticPollution

Environment Ministry (@FMEnvng) (2021-06-05):
In commemoration of the #WorldEnvironmentDay, the office of the HMS @FMEnvng @sharon_ikeazor invites you to a virtual consultation, focused on youth led solutions to plastic pollution in Nigeria on Fri. 4th June 2021 by 11:00am
To Join http://bit.ly/WEnvDay2021
#MurkOutTheOceans
summary:
The posts and conversation about youth-led solutions to plastic pollution have a positive and supportive tone. There is appreciation for the involvement of the youth and recognition of their efforts to address plastic pollution. It's encouraging to see collaboration and engagement from various organizations and individuals to address this environmental issue. 
Sentiment: 0.8
